On Sat, 10 Jul 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> > I'm coming a little late to the thread, but... why can't you just put
> > them all in the same test method?  Break them up if you like:
> >
> > public void testALotOfStuff() {
> >     checkA();
> >     checkB();
> >     checkC();
> > }

Because they all need setUp and tearDown run before and after the tests.

As well, try expressing the more complex dependency tree I did in the
manner above, and you'll find that it gets a bit painful. And also,
especially try the case where there are 20 tests, and of them you want
to run numbers 1 and 2 first, abort if either of those fails, but
otherwise run all the others after.

cjs
